dublinCore.dc:title: 119 S583 IS: Reorganizing Government Act of 2025
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Lee introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs

form.official-title: To amend chapter 9 of title 5, United States Code, to reauthorize the executive reorganization authority of the President and to ensure efficient executive reorganization, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Reorganizing Government Act of 2025.
Chapter 9 of title 5, United States Code, is amended—

clause.text: in paragraph (3), by inserting , including the elimination of operations determined to be unnecessary for the execution of constitutional duties before the semicolon;

subclause.text: by striking agencies in each place the term appears and inserting executive departments; and
by striking and at the end;

clause.text: in paragraph (6), by striking the period and inserting ; and; and
by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.text: to reduce the number of federal employees;

to amend rules, regulations, and other requirements for the purpose of decreasing the cost and difficulty of compliance thereof, and to eliminate unnecessary and burdensome rules, regulations, and other requirements; and
to eliminate government operations that do not serve the public interest.

subparagraph.text: in subsection (d), by striking agencies and inserting executive departments;

paragraph.text: in section 902, by striking paragraph (1) and inserting the following:

clause.text: any executive department, agency, or independent establishment of the United States or any corporation wholly owned by the United States; and
an office or officer of the executive branch; and

subparagraph.text: does not include the Government Accountability Office or the Comptroller General of the United States.
in the matter preceding paragraph (1), by striking agencies and inserting executive departments;
by striking agency in each place the term appears and inserting executive department; and
in paragraph (2), by striking , except that no enforcement function or statutory program shall be abolished by the plan;

paragraph.text: in section 904, by striking agency in each place the term appears and inserting executive department;

clause.text: by redesignating paragraphs (2) through (7) as paragraphs (1) through (6), respectively;
in paragraphs (1), (2), and (3), as so redesignated, by striking agency in each place the term appears and inserting executive department;
in paragraph (4), as so redesignated, by striking new agency and inserting new executive department;
in paragraph (5), as so redesignated, by striking or;
in paragraph (6), as so redesignated, by striking the period and inserting ; or; and
by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.text: creating a net increase in the number of federal workers or a net increase in expenditures.

subparagraph.text: in subsection (b), by striking December 31, 1984 and inserting December 31, 2026;

paragraph.text: in section 907, by striking agency in each place the term appears and inserting executive department;
in section 908, by striking December 31, 1984 and inserting December 31, 2026; and
in section 909, by striking 19 . and inserting 20 ..
